text: The President can do it.  And as the #KavanaughConfirmation is heading to the full Senate, Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell has the power to call for an FBI investigation into the  accusations.
author: AnnCurry

text: Appears it’s up to Senate Majority leader McConnell, who supports #Kavanaugh.   But he could ask for an FBI investigation if too many Senators are unwilling to confirm without one.  Senators Collins, Murkowski and Flake are key.
author: AnnCurry

text: Your confusion is understandable.  Yes there was a vote.  The Senate Judiciary committee approved Kavanaugh’s nomination with Senator Flake saying he would vote yes to pass it out of committee to the full Senate, but could vote  no there, unless the FBI investigates. #Kavanaugh
author: AnnCurry

text: What’s next: now Kavanaugh’s nomination will go before the full Senate, with Senator Flake saying he could vote against Kavanaugh there, unless there is an FBI investigation.  Now Senate leaders will decide whether the FBI investigates. #KavanaughConfirmationHearing
author: AnnCurry

text: Now: Republican Senator Flake favors having the FBI investigate, saying it would be good for the country which is being “pulled apart” by the #KavanaughConfirmation hearings.

text: You are making total sense.  Opinion has a place in journalism, but it is fundamentally dishonest to allow people to think it is news.  It must be clearly marked.  And few reporters are expert enough to have an opinion that truly matters.
author: AnnCurry

text: Thank you.  I hope it helps in this tumultuous time.
author: AnnCurry

text: I think you are right.
author: AnnCurry

text: There is a mixed bag of news and bias on all of them including @FoxNews, depending on the reporter.   Watch with great scrutiny and seek both sides of any story.  Truth is nuanced.
author: AnnCurry

text: You are right to be concerned that we are not getting all the news we need and deserve.
author: AnnCurry

text: Actually I see a lot of bias.  That is the subject of my talk.  To fail to differentiate opinion from news is fundamentally dishonest.
author: AnnCurry

text: Why should anyone really care what a reporter thinks?  That’s not the job.
author: AnnCurry

text: Agreed. Journalism is only trustworthy when it dependably offers accurate, verifiable facts... not bias and speculation and not for ratings, circulations or clicks or any financial or political motivation...but with one motive: to reveal the truth for the greater public good.
author: AnnCurry

text: Cursing at my TV.  And in my @Tedx talk posted today.  News is not left or right.  It’s based on facts that are right or wrong.   Discuss.

text: World's oldest man, 113 yo Henry Allingham, has died in England.  He was a teenager twice.
author: AnnCurry

text: Took him to lunch to thank him.  And discovered he was exactly what he seemed.  Humble, empathetic and gracious.
author: AnnCurry

text: So he surprised me, saying nice things about my reporting on video for an awards ceremony.  HE didn't have to do that.
author: AnnCurry

text: Remembering an act of generosity from Walter Cronkite. Before we met, he heard he was an inspiration.
author: AnnCurry

text: George Clooney: "I hate the world without Walter Cronkite."‬
author: AnnCurry

text: Obama: Walker Cronkite "invited us to believe in him, and he never let us down."
author: AnnCurry

text: Tom Brokaw: Walker Cronkite "cared..passionately about the place of a free press in a democratic republic."
author: AnnCurry

text: Cronkite's legacy includes his worry that journalism has become too soft, too vulnerable to financial interests.
author: AnnCurry

text: Watching Walter Cronkite cover Vietnam and the Civil Rights movement is why I became a journalist.
author: AnnCurry

text: NYT: Walter Cronkite has just died.  At 92, his was a long life well lived.
author: AnnCurry

text: Courage is infectious. Even in the face of the risk of death, there are those who will stand firm. They show us what humans are made of.

Passover commemorates the  the 

Passover commemorates the liberation of Jews from slavery and their Exodus from Egypt.
author: AnnCurry

text: The feast is for thanksgiving and for re-dedication to the idea of liberation.  Pretty cool.  A history of suffering inspiring the future.
author: AnnCurry

text: A Seder is a Jewish ritual feast held every year on the first and the second nights of the Jewish holiday of Passover.
author: AnnCurry

text: The prayers remind Jews they were once slaves in Egypt.   Honoring those who survived that is powerful inspiration.
author: AnnCurry

text: Attending a Seder makes you realize why so many Jews were involved in the Civil Rights movement in the 60's.
author: AnnCurry

text: So Seder in the WH will celebrate the holiday, and "all that has happened in our lives," one official is quoted by NBC News as saying.
author: AnnCurry

text: Last year on the campaign trail, after traditional refrain, "Next year in Jerusalem," they jokingly added, "Next year in the White House!"
author: AnnCurry

text: The first Seder in the White House?  President Obama plans a Seder in the WH with staff to mark Passover.

A NYC detective tells me when  he saw too much suffering, he would just stay in bed for a day.
You know what?  It really helps.

text: Coming back to NYC from the Chadian desert is like coming back into the Matrix.  Another world.  Which one is more real?

text: Anyone who thinks of journalists as being cynical should hear the NYT's Nick Kristof talk about acts of heroism in Darfur.

text: In Chad's camps for Darfur's survivors, we find a schoolhouse named for Obama.  Now that's the audacity of hope.
author: AnnCurry

text: Darfurian children in Chad's refugee camps don't know George Clooney is a movie star.  But they like him for treating them like stars.
author: AnnCurry

text: http://ping.fm/p/qLpGZ - HERE IN A DARFUR REFUGEE CAMP

text:
FOUND AZIZA AND KHAMUS, DARFURIAN REFUGEES WHO WE PROFILED FOR NIGHTLY

text: In one refugee camp a boy sits down before me, his eyes full of suffering  Around his neck, the  amulets that are supposed to protect him.
